meta.notes: Player is a scratch golfer with solid fundamentals using a 7-iron for full swing assessment.

summary.headline: Jordan’s 7-iron swing shows strong fundamentals with opportunities to optimize power and consistency through minor refinements.
bullets: Solid pivot creating good coil and transition.
Consistent clubface control yielding accurate ball flight.
Swing path generally on target with minor inside-out tendencies.
Low point control is good but can be sharper for improved turf interaction.

strengths: Excellent setup posture promoting athletic balance.
Strong and connected pivot generating solid coil.
Flat left wrist through impact for consistent clubface control.
Good sequencing from lower to upper body during downswing.
Consistent start direction with minimal drifting.

priorityFixes.title: Reduce Slight Inside-Out Path
priorityFixes.detail: Focus on feeling a more neutral club path to eliminate slight draws and occasional pushes; this will enhance scoring consistency.

priorityFixes.title: Sharpen Low Point Control
priorityFixes.detail: Work on hitting just past the ball to improve crisp contact and turf interaction, preventing thin or fat shots.

priorityFixes.title: Increase Turn Through Impact
priorityFixes.detail: Develop a more aggressive hip turn through ball contact to unlock additional clubhead speed and power.

powerLeaks: Swing sometimes stops rotation too early at impact, limiting power transfer.
Occasional early extension reduces leverage and swing width.
Minor grip tension inhibits fluid release of clubhead.
Inconsistent weight shift causes subtle deceleration.

checkpoints.label: Setup
checkpoints.note: Posture is athletic and balanced with proper spine angle.
errors: Hip sway due to lack of firm base in rare cases.
Hands occasionally too far forward causing inconsistent low point.
drills: Wall Drill: Setup with butt against wall to feel correct spine tilt.
Balance Board Drill: Practice takeaway to feel stable base.

checkpoints.label: Takeaway
checkpoints.note: Club moves smoothly on an inside path promoting good width.
errors: Too steep takeaway leading to over-the-top downswing.
Early hand casting on some swings.
drills: Gate Drill: Place tees outside clubhead to encourage inside path.
Slow Motion Repetition focusing on low hands and quiet wrists.

checkpoints.label: Backswing Position
checkpoints.note: Full shoulder turn with stable lower body creating good coil.
errors: Over-rotation of hips on rare swings reducing coil.
drills: Pause at top drill to feel coiled position.
Mirror check for hip and shoulder separation.

checkpoints.label: Transition
checkpoints.note: Generally smooth but occasionally starts with upper body leading.
errors: Casting hands early causing loss of lag.
Overuse of arms starting downswing instead of lower body lead.
drills: Hip Bump Drill: Practice starting downswing by shifting weight.
Slow transition swings focusing on sequencing.

checkpoints.label: Downswing
checkpoints.note: Good sequencing but path is slightly inside-out causing mild pushes.
drills: Swing with headcover outside ball to prevent over-the-top swing path.
Step Drill to feel proper weight shift and rotation.

checkpoints.label: Impact
checkpoints.note: Excellent clubface control with square face and solid compression.
errors: Hands sometimes a little ahead of ball reducing loft.
Slight open clubface on some swings causing fade.
drills: Impact Bag Drill for feeling forward shaft lean.
Face Tape Drill to monitor strike pattern.

checkpoints.label: Release
checkpoints.note: Natural and smooth release with good forearm rotation.
drills: Throw Drill to promote natural release of clubhead.
Grip pressure checks during practice swings.

checkpoints.label: Finish
checkpoints.note: Balanced and controlled finish position showing good rotation.
errors: Lack of posture retention causing instability.
drills: Hold Finish Drill to improve balance.
Slow Mo Finish Drill focusing on posture.

checkpoints.label: Start Line Control
checkpoints.note: Consistent start direction with slight right bias within acceptable range.
drills: Alignment Stick Drill focusing on consistent ball position.
Visual start line practice hitting straight shots.

practicePlan.overview: Over the next 14 days, focus on refining your swing path and low point control to sharpen ball striking and power. Begin with basic drills to reinforce fundamentals, then gradually increase speed and pressure scenarios to build consistency.

days.label: DAYS 1–2: Setup & Fundamentals
days.detail: Work on wall and balance board drills to reinforce a solid, athletic setup and balanced base. Ensure spine angle and hand positions are consistent at address.

days.label: DAYS 3–4: Takeaway & Backswing
days.detail: Use gate and pause drills to maintain a smooth inside takeaway and full shoulder turn without hip sway.

days.label: DAYS 5–6: Transition Sequencing
days.detail: Incorporate hip bump and slow transition drills to start downswing with hips and preserve lag to maximize power.

days.label: DAYS 7–8: Downswing Path & Impact
days.detail: Practice swing path drills like the headcover outside ball and impact bag to eliminate inside-out tendencies and sharpen low point control.

days.label: DAYS 9–10: Release & Finish
days.detail: Use throw and finish drills to encourage natural forearm rotation and maintain good posture through the finish.

days.label: DAYS 11–12: Start Line & Alignment
days.detail: Practice alignment stick drills to ensure consistent ball position and start direction straight down target line.

days.label: DAYS 13–14: Integration & Pressure
days.detail: Hit full swings integrating all elements; simulate pressure by aiming for tighter targets to build reliability and confidence.
